00051 /*******************************************************************************
00052  *******************************   DEFINES   ***********************************
00053  ******************************************************************************/
00054 
00058 #if (I2C_COUNT == 1)
00059 #define I2C_REF_VALID(ref)    ((ref) == I2C0)
00060 #elif (I2C_COUNT == 2)
00061 #define I2C_REF_VALID(ref)    ((ref == I2C0) || (ref == I2C1))
00062 #elif (I2C_COUNT == 3)
00063 #define I2C_REF_VALID(ref)    ((ref == I2C0) || (ref == I2C1)|| (ref == I2C2))
00064 #endif
00065 
00067 /* Notice that I2C_IF_TXOF (transmit overflow) is not really possible with */
00068 /* this SW supporting master mode. Likewise for I2C_IF_RXUF (receive underflow) */
00069 /* RXUF is only likely to occur with this SW if using a debugger peeking into */
00070 /* RXDATA register. Thus, we ignore those types of fault. */
00071 #define I2C_IF_ERRORS    (I2C_IF_BUSERR | I2C_IF_ARBLOST)
00072

00076  ********************************   ENUMS   ************************************
00077  ******************************************************************************/
00078 
00082 typedef enum
00083 {
00084   i2cStateStartAddrSend,       
00085   i2cStateAddrWFAckNack,       
00086   i2cStateAddrWF2ndAckNack,    
00087   i2cStateRStartAddrSend,      
00088   i2cStateRAddrWFAckNack,      
00089   i2cStateDataSend,            
00090   i2cStateDataWFAckNack,       
00091   i2cStateWFData,              
00092   i2cStateWFStopSent,          
00093   i2cStateDone                 
00094 } I2C_TransferState_TypeDef;

00125 /*******************************************************************************

00135 static const uint8_t i2cNSum[] = { 4 + 4, 6 + 3, 11 + 6, 4 + 4 };
00136 
00138 static I2C_Transfer_TypeDef i2cTransfer[I2C_COUNT];

00146 /***************************************************************************/
00159 uint32_t I2C_BusFreqGet(I2C_TypeDef *i2c)
00160 {
00161   uint32_t hfperclk;
00162   uint32_t n;
00163 
00164   /* Max frequency is given by fSCL = fHFPERCLK/((Nlow + Nhigh)(DIV + 1) + 4) */
00165   hfperclk = CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_HFPER);
00166   n        = (uint32_t)(i2cNSum[(i2c->CTRL & _I2C_CTRL_CLHR_MASK) >> _I2C_CTRL_CLHR_SHIFT]);
00167 
00168   return(hfperclk / ((n * (i2c->CLKDIV + 1)) + 4));
00169 }
00170 
00171 
00172 /***************************************************************************/
00210 void I2C_BusFreqSet(I2C_TypeDef *i2c,
00211                     uint32_t refFreq,
00212                     uint32_t freq,
00213                     I2C_ClockHLR_TypeDef type)
00214 {
00215   uint32_t n;
00216   uint32_t div;
00217 
00218   /* Avoid divide by 0 */
00219   EFM_ASSERT(freq);
00220   if (!freq)
00221   {
00222     return;
00223   }
00224 
00225   /* Set the CLHR (clock low to high ratio). */
00226   i2c->CTRL &= ~_I2C_CTRL_CLHR_MASK;
00227   i2c->CTRL |= type <<_I2C_CTRL_CLHR_SHIFT;
00228 
00229   /* Frequency is given by fSCL = fHFPERCLK/((Nlow + Nhigh)(DIV + 1) + 4), thus */
00230   /* DIV = ((fHFPERCLK - 4fSCL)/((Nlow + Nhigh)fSCL)) - 1 */
00231 
00232   if (!refFreq)
00233   {
00234     refFreq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_HFPER);
00235   }
00236   n = (uint32_t)(i2cNSum[type]);
00237 
00238   div = (refFreq - (4 * freq)) / (n * freq);
00239 
00240   /* Clock divisor must be at least 1 in slave mode according to reference */
00241   /* manual (in which case there is normally no need to set bus frequency). */
00242   if ((i2c->CTRL & I2C_CTRL_SLAVE) && !div)
00243   {
00244     div = 1;
00245   }
00246 
00247   EFM_ASSERT(div <= _I2C_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK);
00248   i2c->CLKDIV = div;
00249 }
00250

00252 /***************************************************************************/
00265 void I2C_Enable(I2C_TypeDef *i2c, bool enable)
00266 {
00267   EFM_ASSERT(I2C_REF_VALID(i2c));
00268 
00269   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(i2c->CTRL), _I2C_CTRL_EN_SHIFT, enable);
00270 }
00271 
00272 
00273 /***************************************************************************/
00283 void I2C_Init(I2C_TypeDef *i2c, const I2C_Init_TypeDef *init)
00284 {
00285   EFM_ASSERT(I2C_REF_VALID(i2c));
00286 
00287   i2c->IEN = 0;
00288   i2c->IFC = _I2C_IFC_MASK;
00289 
00290   /* Set SLAVE select mode */
00291   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(i2c->CTRL), _I2C_CTRL_SLAVE_SHIFT, init->master ? 0 : 1);
00292 
00293   I2C_BusFreqSet(i2c, init->refFreq, init->freq, init->clhr);
00294 
00295   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(i2c->CTRL), _I2C_CTRL_EN_SHIFT, init->enable);
00296 }

00299 /***************************************************************************/
00310 void I2C_Reset(I2C_TypeDef *i2c)
00311 {
00312   i2c->CTRL      = _I2C_CTRL_RESETVALUE;
00313   i2c->CLKDIV    = _I2C_CLKDIV_RESETVALUE;
00314   i2c->SADDR     = _I2C_SADDR_RESETVALUE;
00315   i2c->SADDRMASK = _I2C_SADDRMASK_RESETVALUE;
00316   i2c->IEN       = _I2C_IEN_RESETVALUE;
00317   i2c->IFC       = _I2C_IFC_MASK;
00318   /* Do not reset route register, setting should be done independently */
00319 }

00322 /***************************************************************************/
00358 I2C_TransferReturn_TypeDef I2C_Transfer(I2C_TypeDef *i2c)
00359 {
00360   uint32_t                tmp;
00361   uint32_t                pending;
00362   I2C_Transfer_TypeDef    *transfer;
00363   I2C_TransferSeq_TypeDef *seq;
00364 
00365   EFM_ASSERT(I2C_REF_VALID(i2c));
00366 
00367   /* Support up to 2 I2C buses */
00368   if (i2c == I2C0)
00369   {
00370     transfer = i2cTransfer;
00371   }
00372 #if (I2C_COUNT > 1)
00373   else if (i2c == I2C1)
00374   {
00375     transfer = i2cTransfer + 1;
00376   }
00377 #endif
00378   else
00379   {
00380     return(i2cTransferUsageFault);
00381   }
00382 
00383   seq = transfer->seq;
00384   for (;; )
00385   {
00386     pending = i2c->IF;
00387 
00388     /* If some sort of fault, abort transfer. */
00389     if (pending & I2C_IF_ERRORS)
00390     {
00391       if (pending & I2C_IF_ARBLOST)
00392       {
00393         /* If arbitration fault, it indicates either a slave device */
00394         /* not responding as expected, or other master which is not */
00395         /* supported by this SW. */
00396         transfer->result = i2cTransferArbLost;
00397       }
00398       else if (pending & I2C_IF_BUSERR)
00399       {
00400         /* A bus error indicates a misplaced start or stop, which should */
00401         /* not occur in master mode controlled by this SW. */
00402         transfer->result = i2cTransferBusErr;
00403       }
00404 
00405       /* If error situation occurred, it is difficult to know */
00406       /* exact cause and how to resolve. It will be up to a wrapper */
00407       /* to determine how to handle a fault/recovery if possible. */
00408       transfer->state = i2cStateDone;
00409       goto done;
00410     }
00411 
00412     switch (transfer->state)
00413     {
00414     /***************************************************/
00415     /* Send first start+address (first byte if 10 bit) */
00416     /***************************************************/
00417     case i2cStateStartAddrSend:
00418       if (seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_10BIT_ADDR)
00419       {
00420         tmp = (((uint32_t)(seq->addr) >> 8) & 0x06) | 0xf0;
00421 
00422         /* In 10 bit address mode, the address following the first */
00423         /* start always indicate write. */
00424       }
00425       else
00426       {
00427         tmp = (uint32_t)(seq->addr) & 0xfe;
00428 
00429         if (seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_READ)
00430         {
00431           /* Indicate read request */
00432           tmp |= 1;
00433         }
00434       }
00435 
00436       transfer->state = i2cStateAddrWFAckNack;
00437       i2c->TXDATA     = tmp; /* Data not transmitted until START sent */
00438       i2c->CMD        = I2C_CMD_START;
00439       goto done;
00440 
00441     /*******************************************************/
00442     /* Wait for ACK/NACK on address (first byte if 10 bit) */
00443     /*******************************************************/
00444     case i2cStateAddrWFAckNack:
00445       if (pending & I2C_IF_NACK)
00446       {
00447         i2c->IFC         = I2C_IFC_NACK;
00448         transfer->result = i2cTransferNack;
00449         transfer->state  = i2cStateWFStopSent;
00450         i2c->CMD         = I2C_CMD_STOP;
00451       }
00452       else if (pending & I2C_IF_ACK)
00453       {
00454         i2c->IFC = I2C_IFC_ACK;
00455 
00456         /* If 10 bit address, send 2nd byte of address. */
00457         if (seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_10BIT_ADDR)
00458         {
00459           transfer->state = i2cStateAddrWF2ndAckNack;
00460           i2c->TXDATA     = (uint32_t)(seq->addr) & 0xff;
00461         }
00462         else
00463         {
00464           /* Determine whether receiving or sending data */
00465           if (seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_READ)
00466           {
00467             transfer->state = i2cStateWFData;
00468             if(seq->buf[transfer->bufIndx].len==1)
00469             {
00470               i2c->CMD  = I2C_CMD_NACK;
00471             }
00472           }
00473           else
00474           {
00475             transfer->state = i2cStateDataSend;
00476             continue;
00477           }
00478         }
00479       }
00480       goto done;
00481 
00482     /******************************************************/
00483     /* Wait for ACK/NACK on second byte of 10 bit address */
00484     /******************************************************/
00485     case i2cStateAddrWF2ndAckNack:
00486       if (pending & I2C_IF_NACK)
00487       {
00488         i2c->IFC         = I2C_IFC_NACK;
00489         transfer->result = i2cTransferNack;
00490         transfer->state  = i2cStateWFStopSent;
00491         i2c->CMD         = I2C_CMD_STOP;
00492       }
00493       else if (pending & I2C_IF_ACK)
00494       {
00495         i2c->IFC = I2C_IFC_ACK;
00496 
00497         /* If using plain read sequence with 10 bit address, switch to send */
00498         /* repeated start. */
00499         if (seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_READ)
00500         {
00501           transfer->state = i2cStateRStartAddrSend;
00502         }
00503         /* Otherwise expected to write 0 or more bytes */
00504         else
00505         {
00506           transfer->state = i2cStateDataSend;
00507         }
00508         continue;
00509       }
00510       goto done;
00511 
00512     /*******************************/
00513     /* Send repeated start+address */
00514     /*******************************/
00515     case i2cStateRStartAddrSend:
00516       if (seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_10BIT_ADDR)
00517       {
00518         tmp = ((seq->addr >> 8) & 0x06) | 0xf0;
00519       }
00520       else
00521       {
00522         tmp = seq->addr & 0xfe;
00523       }
00524 
00525       /* If this is a write+read combined sequence, then read is about to start */
00526       if (seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_WRITE_READ)
00527       {
00528         /* Indicate read request */
00529         tmp |= 1;
00530       }
00531 
00532       transfer->state = i2cStateRAddrWFAckNack;
00533       /* We have to write START cmd first since repeated start, otherwise */
00534       /* data would be sent first. */
00535       i2c->CMD    = I2C_CMD_START;
00536       i2c->TXDATA = tmp;
00537       goto done;
00538 
00539     /**********************************************************************/
00540     /* Wait for ACK/NACK on repeated start+address (first byte if 10 bit) */
00541     /**********************************************************************/
00542     case i2cStateRAddrWFAckNack:
00543       if (pending & I2C_IF_NACK)
00544       {
00545         i2c->IFC         = I2C_IFC_NACK;
00546         transfer->result = i2cTransferNack;
00547         transfer->state  = i2cStateWFStopSent;
00548         i2c->CMD         = I2C_CMD_STOP;
00549       }
00550       else if (pending & I2C_IF_ACK)
00551       {
00552         i2c->IFC = I2C_IFC_ACK;
00553 
00554         /* Determine whether receiving or sending data */
00555         if (seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_WRITE_READ)
00556         {
00557           transfer->state = i2cStateWFData;
00558         }
00559         else
00560         {
00561           transfer->state = i2cStateDataSend;
00562           continue;
00563         }
00564       }
00565       goto done;
00566 
00567     /*****************************/
00568     /* Send a data byte to slave */
00569     /*****************************/
00570     case i2cStateDataSend:
00571       /* Reached end of data buffer? */
00572       if (transfer->offset >= seq->buf[transfer->bufIndx].len)
00573       {
00574         /* Move to next message part */
00575         transfer->offset = 0;
00576         transfer->bufIndx++;
00577 
00578         /* Send repeated start when switching to read mode on 2nd buffer */
00579         if (seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_WRITE_READ)
00580         {
00581           transfer->state = i2cStateRStartAddrSend;
00582           continue;
00583         }
00584 
00585         /* Only writing from one buffer, or finished both buffers */
00586         if ((seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_WRITE) || (transfer->bufIndx > 1))
00587         {
00588           transfer->state = i2cStateWFStopSent;
00589           i2c->CMD        = I2C_CMD_STOP;
00590           goto done;
00591         }
00592 
00593         /* Reprocess in case next buffer is empty */
00594         continue;
00595       }
00596 
00597       /* Send byte */
00598       i2c->TXDATA     = (uint32_t)(seq->buf[transfer->bufIndx].data[transfer->offset++]);
00599       transfer->state = i2cStateDataWFAckNack;
00600       goto done;
00601 
00602     /*********************************************************/
00603     /* Wait for ACK/NACK from slave after sending data to it */
00604     /*********************************************************/
00605     case i2cStateDataWFAckNack:
00606       if (pending & I2C_IF_NACK)
00607       {
00608         i2c->IFC         = I2C_IFC_NACK;
00609         transfer->result = i2cTransferNack;
00610         transfer->state  = i2cStateWFStopSent;
00611         i2c->CMD         = I2C_CMD_STOP;
00612       }
00613       else if (pending & I2C_IF_ACK)
00614       {
00615         i2c->IFC        = I2C_IFC_ACK;
00616         transfer->state = i2cStateDataSend;
00617         continue;
00618       }
00619       goto done;
00620 
00621     /****************************/
00622     /* Wait for data from slave */
00623     /****************************/
00624     case i2cStateWFData:
00625       if (pending & I2C_IF_RXDATAV)
00626       {
00627         uint8_t       data;
00628         unsigned int  rxLen = seq->buf[transfer->bufIndx].len;
00629 
00630         /* Must read out data in order to not block further progress */
00631         data = (uint8_t)(i2c->RXDATA);
00632 
00633         /* Make sure not storing beyond end of buffer just in case */
00634         if (transfer->offset < rxLen)
00635         {
00636           seq->buf[transfer->bufIndx].data[transfer->offset++] = data;
00637         }
00638 
00639         /* If we have read all requested data, then the sequence should end */
00640         if (transfer->offset >= rxLen)
00641         {
00642           /* If there is only one byte to receive we need to transmit the
00643              NACK now, before the stop. */
00644           if (1 == rxLen)
00645           {
00646             i2c->CMD  = I2C_CMD_NACK;
00647           }
00648 
00649           transfer->state = i2cStateWFStopSent;
00650           i2c->CMD        = I2C_CMD_STOP;
00651         }
00652         else
00653         {
00654           /* Send ACK and wait for next byte */
00655           i2c->CMD = I2C_CMD_ACK;
00656 
00657           if ( (1<rxLen) && (transfer->offset == (rxLen-1)) )
00658           {
00659             /* If there is more than one byte to receive and this is the next
00660                to last byte we need to transmit the NACK now, before receiving
00661                the last byte. */
00662             i2c->CMD  = I2C_CMD_NACK;
00663           }
00664         }
00665       }
00666       goto done;
00667 
00668     /***********************************/
00669     /* Wait for STOP to have been sent */
00670     /***********************************/
00671     case i2cStateWFStopSent:
00672       if (pending & I2C_IF_MSTOP)
00673       {
00674         i2c->IFC        = I2C_IFC_MSTOP;
00675         transfer->state = i2cStateDone;
00676       }
00677       goto done;
00678 
00679     /******************************/
00680     /* Unexpected state, SW fault */
00681     /******************************/
00682     default:
00683       transfer->result = i2cTransferSwFault;
00684       transfer->state  = i2cStateDone;
00685       goto done;
00686     }
00687   }
00688 
00689  done:
00690 
00691   if (transfer->state == i2cStateDone)
00692   {
00693     /* Disable interrupt sources when done */
00694     i2c->IEN = 0;
00695 
00696     /* Update result unless some fault already occurred */
00697     if (transfer->result == i2cTransferInProgress)
00698     {
00699       transfer->result = i2cTransferDone;
00700     }
00701   }
00702   /* Until transfer is done keep returning i2cTransferInProgress */
00703   else
00704   {
00705     return(i2cTransferInProgress);
00706   }
00707 
00708   return transfer->result;
00709 }
00710 
00711 
00712 /***************************************************************************/
00737 I2C_TransferReturn_TypeDef I2C_TransferInit(I2C_TypeDef *i2c,
00738                                             I2C_TransferSeq_TypeDef *seq)
00739 {
00740   I2C_Transfer_TypeDef *transfer;
00741 
00742   EFM_ASSERT(I2C_REF_VALID(i2c));
00743   EFM_ASSERT(seq);
00744 
00745   /* Support up to 2 I2C buses */
00746   if (i2c == I2C0)
00747   {
00748     transfer = i2cTransfer;
00749   }
00750 #if (I2C_COUNT > 1)
00751   else if (i2c == I2C1)
00752   {
00753     transfer = i2cTransfer + 1;
00754   }
00755 #endif
00756   else
00757   {
00758     return(i2cTransferUsageFault);
00759   }
00760 
00761   /* Check if in busy state. Since this SW assumes single master, we can */
00762   /* just issue an abort. The BUSY state is normal after a reset. */
00763   if (i2c->STATE & I2C_STATE_BUSY)
00764   {
00765     i2c->CMD = I2C_CMD_ABORT;
00766   }
00767 
00768   /* Make sure user is not trying to read 0 bytes, it is not */
00769   /* possible according to I2C spec, since slave will always start */
00770   /* sending first byte ACK on address. The read operation can */
00771   /* only be stopped by NACKing a received byte, ie minimum 1 byte. */
00772   if (((seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_READ) && !(seq->buf[0].len)) ||
00773       ((seq->flags & I2C_FLAG_WRITE_READ) && !(seq->buf[1].len))
00774       )
00775   {
00776     return(i2cTransferUsageFault);
00777   }
00778 
00779   /* Prepare for a transfer */
00780   transfer->state   = i2cStateStartAddrSend;
00781   transfer->result  = i2cTransferInProgress;
00782   transfer->offset  = 0;
00783   transfer->bufIndx = 0;
00784   transfer->seq     = seq;
00785 
00786   /* Ensure buffers are empty */
00787   i2c->CMD = I2C_CMD_CLEARPC | I2C_CMD_CLEARTX;
00788   if (i2c->IF & I2C_IF_RXDATAV)
00789   {
00790     (void)i2c->RXDATA;
00791   }
00792 
00793   /* Clear all pending interrupts prior to starting transfer. */
00794   i2c->IFC = _I2C_IFC_MASK;
00795 
00796   /* Enable those interrupts we are interested in throughout transfer. */
00797   /* Notice that the I2C interrupt must also be enabled in the NVIC, but */
00798   /* that is left for an additional driver wrapper. */
00799   i2c->IEN = I2C_IF_NACK | I2C_IF_ACK | I2C_IF_MSTOP |
00800              I2C_IF_RXDATAV | I2C_IF_ERRORS;
00801 
00802   /* Start transfer */
00803   return(I2C_Transfer(i2c));
00804 }
00805 
00808 #endif /* defined(I2C_COUNT) && (I2C_COUNT > 0) */
Generated on Thu Sep 10 11:31:04 2015 for Silicon Labs EFM32 emlib Peripheral Library by  1.4.7
